item.title: PostgreSQL reconsiders its process-based model
item.description: - PostgreSQL, a popular database system, is considering a fundamental change to move away from its process-oriented model.

item.title: OpenLLM
item.description: - OpenLLM is an open platform for operating large language models (LLMs) in production.

item.title: Titanic tourist submersible goes missing with search under way
item.description: - A tourist submarine, the Titan submersible, has gone missing during a dive to the wreck of the Titanic in the mid-Atlantic.

item.title: Twitter lawyers overwhelmed as laid off employees file arbitration claims
item.description: - Twitter lawyers are facing a surge of arbitration claims from laid off employees.

item.title: Releasing an indie game on 3 consoles at once & failing financially (2016)
item.description: - The indie game "Toto Temple Deluxe" was released on multiple consoles simultaneously, but it did not sell well financially.

item.title: Display brighter-than-white color on Apple devices
item.description: - The post introduces a technique called "superwhitedisplay" which allows users to display a very bright white color on Apple devices with HDR support.

item.title: We tried to book a train ticket & ended up with a 245k records data breach
item.description: - The article discusses a data breach that occurred during the distribution of free train tickets for young adults in Germany and France.

item.title: TypeScript 5.2's new keyword: 'Using'
item.description: - This post explains why {} in TypeScript does not actually represent an empty object.

item.title: Show HN: Slint â€“ A declarative UI toolkit for embedded & desktop
item.description: - Slint is a declarative UI toolkit that allows developers to build native user interfaces for embedded systems and desktop applications.

item.title: My First Impressions of Nix
item.description: - Nix is a tool for configuring software environments using source files, and it's gaining popularity among developers.
